title: Cypress Target
description: Cypress target option for Build Facade.

cypressConfig.description: The path of the Cypress configuration json file.

watch.description: Recompile and run tests when files change.

tsConfig.description: The path of the Cypress tsconfig configuration json file.

devServerTarget.description: Dev server target to run tests against.

headed.description: Displays the browser instead of running headlessly. Set this to `true` if your run depends on a Chrome extension being loaded.

headless.description: Hide the browser instead of running headed (default for cypress run).

exit.description: Whether or not the Cypress Test Runner will stay open after running tests in a spec file.

key.description: The key cypress should use to run tests in parallel/record the run (CI only).

record.description: Whether or not Cypress should record the results of the tests.

parallel.description: Whether or not Cypress should run its tests in parallel (CI only).

baseUrl.description: The address (with the port) which your application is running on.

browser.description: The browser to run tests in.

env.description: A key-value Pair of environment variables to pass to Cypress runner.

spec.description: A comma delimited glob string that is provided to the Cypress runner to specify which spec files to run. i.e. `**examples/**,**actions.spec**`.

copyFiles.description: A regex string that is used to choose what additional integration files to copy to the dist folder.

ciBuildId.description: A unique identifier for a run to enable grouping or parallelization.

group.description: A named group for recorded runs in the Cypress dashboard.

ignoreTestFiles.description: A String or Array of glob patterns used to ignore test files that would otherwise be shown in your list of tests. Cypress uses minimatch with the options: `{dot: true, matchBase: true}`. We suggest using https://globster.xyz to test what files would match.

reporter.description: The reporter used during cypress run.

reporterOptions.description: The reporter options used. Supported options depend on the reporter.

testingType.description: Specify the type of tests to execute.

tag.description: A comma delimited list to identify a run with.
